授業目的: This class provides internship opportunities for students to “simulate” their future job application processes for and have hands-on working experience at the United Nations as well as other relevant organisations and agencies including NGOs.
到達目標: Students will have successfully been accepted as intern at a UN agency or relevant organisations/agencies including international NGOs, have completed assigned tasks so that competencies gained through internship would contribute to future job applications at UN and various other international organisations/agencies.
関連科目: Career Seminar for International Organizations, Management of International Organizations, Seminar in Global Communication, Seminar in Global Diversity
授業の概要・背景: This class provides students with opportunities to broaden their knowledge and construct competencies through the following experiences; (1) searching for internship opportunities, (2) preparing application documents, (3) going through job interviews, (4) performing assigned tasks, and (5) get assessed by their performance.  Students are expected to gain a better-focussed career and competency development plan by reflecting their internship experiences.
授業方法: Orientation, consultation, guidance and assessment before, during and after the internship.

トピック.授業計画1:
Pre-departure programme:
1. Initial orientation and expression of their interest areas and organizations (at the beginning of first year)
2. Assignment of students to relevant professors, and consultation with advising professors.
3. Search for internship opportunities and selection of a number of posts.
4. Preparation of internship documents, including letter of intent and curriculum vitae
5. Contacting organizations and sending applications (3-6 months before internship)
6. Screening and interviews, acceptance of interns by selected organization/s
7. Preparation for departure and departure

During internship:
1. Arrival, initial guidance, confirmation of terms of reference, and settlement. (first reporting)
2. Periodical and mid-term consultation with professors (email or video conference based)
3. Completion of internship assignment and assessment of internship by supervising officer. (As per Evaluation sheet)

After internship:
1. Final reporting on internship
2. Updating students’ career and competency development plans based on internship experience.
トピック.授業外学習2: This internship is a commitment and an opportunity, thus should be taken seriously throughout the internship processes. Students are expected to enhance their UN competencies including their core values and core competencies, as well as their understanding of the organisation that they will apply for and contribute to as intern.
